means: 使羞愧，使局促，使窘迫( abash的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_cn: 他看起来有点困窘，很不自在。

sentence.Network_en: He glanced at Juliet accusingly and she looked suitably abashed.
sentence.Network_cn: 他怪罪的一瞥,朱丽叶自然显得很窘.

sentence.Network_en: The girl was abashed by the laughter of her classmates.
sentence.Network_cn: 那小姑娘因同学的哄笑而局促不安.

abash 使局促不安abashed 不安的abashment 羞愧
《不择手段背单词》完整版 - 豆丁网 ... base 源自拉丁语 abashed adj 不安的，窘迫的＝ embarrassed 【记】中间有.

list.abs: felt abashed at the extravagant praise ;, 对过分的表扬感到脸红;
I listened to this word to feel be ashamed already comfort again , I also had had this kind of panic-stricken feel abashed show .我听了这话感到既惭愧又安慰，我也有过这种惊慌失措的羞人表现。
take the stand [美]出庭作证; 为...担保witness stand 证人席stand abashed 感到羞愧, 感到拘促不安stand against 抵抗, 反抗; 靠在...上; 经受住.
I stood abashed at his rebuke ., 面对他的斥责我感到无地自容.

entry.def: If you are abashed, you feel embarrassed and ashamed.

example.tran: 他看起来有点困窘，很不自在。

means.word_mean: 1. feeling or caused to feel uneasy and self-conscious;

sentences.sentence: "chagrined at the poor sales of his book"
